page.title: 01Braintree,Bocking and Rayne
page.content: The twelve kilometre block covers an area of{Essex}and contains the village of{Rayne}and part of the towns of { {Braintree and Bocking.} Braintree is 12 miles north east of Chelmsford and 16 miles west of Colchester. Its town centre used to be at the crossroad of two major roads, one the Chelmsford to Halstead road and the second being the Colchester to Bishop's Stortford road, although this fact is obscured by the modern road network going around the town. The population of Braintree, Bocking and Rayne is roughly thirty thousand. Farming is one of the popular industries in this block with many hectares of barley,wheat,potatoes and oats under crops. Market day is Wednesday and early closing is Thursday.
